title.narrative: Improve the access of internally displaced people in Yemen to educational services.

description.narrative: Contribute to achieving stability and recovery in the governorates of Aden, Lahj and Hadramout, and the sustainable reintegration of returnees and internally displaced persons into host societies through projects directed at serving local communities to improve educational opportunities, and thus respond to some of the urgent needs that resulted from massive return movements and build confidence between internally displaced persons, host communities and returnees from On the one hand, and between the government and local communities on the other hand, by improving public services for the target population.

This project aims to improve access to basic services (education) for returnees, host communities and internally displaced people in Aden, Lahj and Hadramawt governorates, which face some of the highest rates of displacement and return in Yemen.

This project will target eight schools in need of rehabilitation and reconstruction, furniture and equipment that have deteriorated due to years of conflict and neglect. In total, the project will target an estimated 4,500 students and 400 school personnel.
